Label: Narrative
Text: The MOVING reference member state of this VC (Value Chain) is PORTUGAL ESTRELA. The reference MOVING Card ID of this VC is VC 13 PT2. Elderberry flowers are harvested at Serra da Estrela and used to produce Elderberry Flower Liqueur. This product is then sold at national and international levels.   The reference mountain chain of this VC is Cordilheira Central (RR08). The reference mountain landscape of this VC is Covilhã. Located on the southwest slope of Serra da Estrela, Covilhã is a municipality with 21 parishes, in the district of Guarda in the Centre region of Portugal. Covilhã shares with the municipalities of Seia and Manteigas, the highest point in mainland Portugal at 1993 meters of altitude. Nowadays, the city of Covilhã is one of the main European centers for wool production. Tradicional economic activities in Covilhã include wool industry and production of dairy products from sheep's milk.   The size of the area (km2) is 554.26. The minimum altimetry of the LAU (Local Administrative Unit) is 353. The maximum altimetry of the LAU is 1993. The total population (in thousand) is 46.787. The population density (Inhabitants/km2) in the LAU is 84.2. The population change rate of the LAU in the last 10 years (%) has been -0.10%. The overall regional population density (Inhabitants/km2) is 78.6. The regional population change rate in the last 10 years (%) has been -0.05%. The secondary sector share of total employment/year [Region] is 48.20%. The tertiary sector share of total employment/year [Region] is 38.55%.   Internationally distinguished product. Elderberry Flower Liqueur is available through e-commerce. Innovative product. Product highly connected to local natural asset.   Elderberry is an autochthonous shrub, distributed mainly in the northern half of Portugal and that grows at Serra da Estrela above 800 m of altitude. It is a deciduous plant, from 2 m to 5 m in height, with white flowers and black berries. It is monoecious and flowering occurs from March to June.    Will climate change affect Elderberry distribution and quality?. Overall the type of challenge faced by this VC is Predicted. This VC is classified as Innovative.   The type of innovation of this VC (Value Chain) is Endogenous. Creation of a new type of liqueur from an autochthonous species. The innovation is related to New products. The land use systems involved are N/A. The local assets include Natural.
